intro: Corunastylis woollsii, commonly known as the Woolly Stylidium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry, harsh environments. It is a perennial herb that often forms dense mats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
